positive.review: Yes I would recommend this game.   Been a Sims player since it began.  I have never been able to use a joy stick or controller never used them in my youth.  I am a senior citizen.  I do love this game but controls are still a learning curve for me.  But it is worth every effort.  Graphics are amazing.  Please keep the people animators.

I think it's only fair I leave my review after 570 hours.

I love this game, I'm a huge fan of the Zoo Tycoon series, since it came out. I can't stress enough how amazing this game is! 

10/10

I like the game. But the information on African Spurred Tortoise states 10 years for sexual maturity in the green species information portion of the screen and 15 years for sexual maturity in the white species information portion of the screen. I would suggest more fact checks when content is released.

let me tell you a story about this game on my first ever zoo one of the first animals i got were peahens these peahens bread like fuxxing rats soon i got overwhelmed by just how many there were and their enclosure was constantly dirty so they were constantly getting sick like my animals i was getting sick of managing thier enviroment so i took em all out and replaced it with a butterfly exhibit but since most of the pea hens were babies i couldint just give em away and it was getting anoying to just have em waiting in the trade center so i kinda just put them in the wolf enviroment and that solved that

I've always loved zoo games, or making zoos on game. This gives every chance to live the dream of building the perfect zoo. Not just one type of zoo, so many different types of zoo, even without DLCs, but DLCs open so much more up. I don't regret any of the money I've spent on this game. 

Being able to have realistic ways of running a zoo, career paths that teach you everything, sandbox, and challenges just adds to the urge of wanting to play more. The animals are cute and realistic, and the people and style of the game brings the nostalgic feel of the SIMS. The over all game play is fun and addicting.

In sandbox I love all the customizable settings, Along in the whole game it's self, being able to make the same animal a different exhibit each time.

Only thing I wish it had more of would be Multiplayer, and maybe some more free content, as the DLCs can rank up and get expensive. I honestly only bought what i have because they were on sale.

Planet Zoo is hands down the best zoo simulator ever made. The animals are unbelievably detailed, the environments feel alive, and the level of creativity the game allows is ridiculous. If you can dream it, you can build it — from realistic enclosures to full-on fantasy zoos. Watching your habitats come to life with animals behaving naturally never gets old.

Yes, the game has a learning curve and the building tools take time to master, but that’s part of what makes it so rewarding. Once it “clicks,” Planet Zoo becomes one of the most satisfying and immersive building/management games out there. Every new animal, every new habitat, every little design detail feels exciting.

The community is great, the Workshop content is endless, and the game keeps getting better with updates and DLC. If you love animals, building, or simulation games, this is basically a dream come true.

A masterpiece of creativity and animal care.
Great visuals. A lot of care was clearly put into the game. It doesn't scratch the exact same itch as Zoo Tycoon 2, but it comes pretty dang close.

If you liked Zoo Tycoon, you should love this. Some of the building takes getting used to, but there is freedom to create so much. The graphics are amazing and you can tell they really did a good job trying to get the animals are realistic as they could. 

Just ignoring the path system, it's an amazing game

A fun game overall but there are a few nitpicks I have. 

TLDR
The game is fun overall with a bit of a learning curve to get the hang of. There are a few things that should be improved like custom building and landscaping. DLC isn't necessary to enjoy, if you do buy make sure to read reviews. 

Issues
The game has a lot of DLC that frankly doesn't add much for the most part. Some of the landscaping tools and how they work are frankly frustrating. I also wish it would allow for custom waterfalls. The custom building is also a pain and takes forever to get something half decent. I love the way the live animal market works however it also means that getting some animals is borderline impossible due to price or that no one is selling them. Animal enclosure designs can be quite frustrating especially shelter because the premade ones are ugly and when you make your own it can be finicky in counting it as shelter. Water for enclosures can also be difficult however once you get the hang of it it's better and not that hard. Another issue is that some animals behave inaccurately or very similarly to other animals making them feel like a reskin. Also most reptiles and snakes are in boxes and don't do much so if you are here for snakes, not for you. Also there are no birds besides the ones that don't fly. 

Positives 
The money making and managing in general is quite balanced I would say not to hard or easy at least in franchise mode. The animals are fun to breed and watch for the most part. There are plenty of morphs to get into. The game is fun and customizable with many things to do. The graphics are pretty good as well. The animal market does make the game feel alive with an economy of players. So if you want to play to make as much as possible then that is possible, the market behaves somewhat unpredictably so there is plenty to loose or gain. The DLC does add more buildings and animals but it doesn't add gameplay mechanics. There is a lot of decoration and detailing capabilities, with a few caveats I mentioned earlier.
The best zoo simulation game currently available. If you played Zoo Tycoon 2 you'll love this game.
Worth the purchace. Elegant dlc's, relaxing gameplay. Easy to learn.
Good game, really looking forward to the next game with hopefully even more details to animal keeping and species

I love it.
It's my chill game.
It has great building/terraforming/decorating toolset.
Developers constantly add new content - with every paid dlc there is a cool new mechanic added to the base game, so its always cool to come back to the game after some time and check how many new things there are.
Campaign is long, and that's a plus for me. I've spent 200hr playing it, so a lot of fun if you struggle with blank sheet Franchise mode. And there are still optional scenarios I haven't even started.
Animals are cute and they have a lot of custom behaviours, it's fun to just attach a camera to one of them, sit back and watch what are they or their cohabitants doing.
It's like Zoo Tycoon, but so much better!  Much more customization, and several different ways to play (career, franchise, sandbox).
Great game, hard to get a grasp on at first but only because the game is so detailed and customisable.

It's a fun game for funs of casual building. I can spend hours upon hours on building a habitat or buildings in the game, and the many different items available give you the freedom to make anything you want. Great for creatives and casuals! Also, the animals are adorable and the models look great.
I'd say it's a 8/10 game that I do really love. It's just missing a bit of better editing features, a better work zoning system and better terrain tools.

Planet Zoo is the Zoo Tycoon sequel we always deserved, maybe the greatest management sim ever made, and a genuine delight. The DLC will likely give us fully aquatic and flying animals, but the first one has a depth of animal variety and enough content to be worth playing for years regardless of Planet Zoo 2.

If you miss zoo tycoon 2 this is a MUST have game. i feel like a kid again and can EASILY spend my whole day on this game. The mods are GREAT too, and the workshop is THE BEST for those who want to build but take a long time to learn how.

Tutorials are not adequate enough to understand how to build in this game. I just looked up things as they came up, and watched a few tips and tricks videos (shout out to adamup on YouTube). Once I understood how to build, I started having such a great time! The potential for customization is vast, and has really kept me from losing interest thus far. 

There are still some aspects of building that are a bit tricky and annoying, like placing paths, or placing picnic benches (it doesn't matter how much I flatten my terrain, it still says it's uneven). But it hasn't been enough to deter me. 

Only other thing I would gripe about at this time is that there are a lot of issues with my animals that I had to look into because the game didn't adequately tell me what was going on. I think it expects you to infer certain things based on the species in question, but that isn't super helpful to a beginner. Other than that, I've really enjoyed myself. Don't give up on the game just because it takes a little research. I promise it's worth it in the end!

I love this game. Animals are my favorite thing and taking care of and designing a zoo is perfect. The animals are beautiful, and its so fun to get better at building beautiful enclosures for your favorite animals. AND THE BABIES!!!! AH so so cute
I played this game just for a couple of times.. But every time I do... its several hours of pure happiness :D
Fantastic game. Different levels of difficulty and tons of animals even in the base game. New updates and add on packs go on sale frequent. New animals are added for free regularly.
I like the game, it is a way of getting to know more about different animals, but the gameplay is also entertaining and enjoyable!

Planet Zoo... there's a lot I can say, but I don't exactly feel like writing an entire essay of why this game is good and it isn't too hard to tell why. Overall, I don't gave many games (As of now.) But this game is one of those not many games. So... yeah. Planet Zoo, it's been in my library a while and I kind of just... overlooked it, I guess you could say. But, until probably Planet Zoo 2, this game my favourite Frontier game AND tycoon game. Is it addicting? Well... maybe a little bit. Just... just a little bit. Will this game ever get boring? Yeah, not a chance. This game will become one of those classics a in 2050 something. Kinda like Mario now. What I am trying to say, is the prospect of building a zoo won't ever get boring. The only thing that sucks in this game is that the guests wellfare is just as important as the animals. Well, that is not my official complaint, that would go to the build function. It can be very... difficult sometimes. But, that could also be a skill issue on my part. In fact, yeah, it is a skill issue on my part. So that only means one thing... this game isn't bad anywhere! Anyway, if you're just looking for a good tycoon game, you have no need to go further than Planet Zoo.

To sum it up: Yes, Planet Zoo is a good game.
Very calm and relaxing game, you can get very creative with how you build the zoo. Love how the animals look and are animated. The only annoying thing is the path building.
Great graphics, Team put a lot of work to reflect animals behaviours and movement. Interesting educational content about animals. Interesting "fun facts". Great experience! :)

It's worth a game if you'd take the time to understand the mechanics through the games tutorials, google searches, Reddit, and Youtube videos. Also if you are passionate/love wildlife conservation, management, and construction building, this is VERY FUN. DLC may be too expensive and some animals should've been included in the base game, I'd say buy it during Winter Sale to get the most out of it, and if you know what you like, you'd definitely won't regret buying it. The game never fails to lure me back to play again once a while, which means it still has a spark even after 6 years. I've only bought it for a year, but already got hundreds of playtime, and with that, I can say, without a doubt, this games a boppppppppppppppppppppppp

I really enjoy the fact that there are "introduction levels."
When you first open up the game you might not know what needs and wants the animals have. The introduction really guides you through that and much more. That way you can build a great zoo.
a lot of fun i enjoy going between the different game modes and the story in one of them
After a few hundred hours it's time to leave a review. Great game. That bear sure likes the hose.
Awesome, this game came out ages ago, but the developer is still dropping new DLC
Probably one of my favorite games of all time ngl. Very hyped for the second one. Frontier if you see this PLEASE improve water and give us aquariums

Planet Zoo is an amazing successor to the Zoo Tycoon series, a game I sunk hundreds of hours into as a kid. What I love most about this game is the amount of freedom it gives you to create your park with sandbox mode giving the player a bunch of options for how they want to play. I've spent so much time literally just designing custom barriers for animal enclosures, which might sound weird but it is so fun! If you're looking for a simulation game or have a creative itch in you, if you enjoy nature at all this game is perfect for you! I would recommend buying the base game on it's own before any DLC, if you find that you want more building options or more animals then go for some expansion packs after you've given the game a try. (Also there is a modding community that upload custom animals you can try out as well!) All in all I love this game and it's everything I'd want out of a "Zoo Tycoon 3"
Played this game so many times now! I love it so much! The animals are cute and the graphics are amazing. They've put lots of time and effort making this game perfect! <3
I simply love this game. I love the relaxed nature of the sandbox and the challenges of the campaigns. This is my type of simulation game.
Best game but sum water animal is need in game so much better

I absolutely recommend this game! It is absolutely addicting and I love building zoos and animal enclosures. The graphics look great, and all the animals are a joy to watch! My favorite is the Asian Small Clawed Otters.

I’ve played this game a lot and own every DLC for it. It’s a really relaxing game where you can build your own zoo however you want. You can start completely from scratch and design every building yourself, or you can use premade structures or ones from the workshop.

I’m more into building the zoo and producing gold animals, so I usually use workshop buildings to fit whatever theme I’m going for.

I’d definitely recommend it if you’re looking for a calming game that involves animals and creating your own zoo for people to explore!

I recommend this game to people who have A LOT of patience. Maybe I'm just a dimwit, but the learning curve behind this game is difficult. I don't want to have to watch videos of seasoned players to understand it. I think it should be a little easier to get the hang of right out of the gate. Some difficulty is fine, but I cant even figure out how to build a hut right now LOL. I got super frustrated trying to figure out walls and paths after 20 minutes... in a tutorial.... and quit to regain my sanity. A game like this should be chill, not causing me more stress lol. I will say, the game itself is absolutely beautiful. The animals are precious, but there's A LOT going on with staff and buildings and it feels like chaos. I'm hoping more play in the tutorials will help me grasp this game and understand what the heck I'm doing... I think I'll learn to LOVE it like everyone else eventually, but right now, send help lol.
It is a great relaxing sandbox game that is enjoyable to play.

planet zoo is a beautifully detailed and creative zoo-building game that offers realistic animal behavior and deep management gameplay. 
its powerful construction tools and stunning visuals make every zoo feel unique and alive .
thanks to the developers for creating such an amazing and heartfelt experience .
Un juego para muchas horas. muy recomendado si te gusta contruir y aprender sobre la naturaleza y animales.
This is my go to when I'm looking to waste a few hours on building a single enclosure. One of the best sims out there without a doubt and the devs are constantly releasing updates.

Limitless possibilities for your creativity. The only think that gets frustrating is the pathing system. PlanCo 2 did a great job at resolving that. Fingers crossed they will incorporate that for Planet Zoo 2. The devs really do listen to the community!

Genuinely such a great city-esq building game. All the different animals are lovingly animated and they keep adding so much to this game with each DLC. Highly recommended, though it's important that your computer can handle this beefy game.

I was an avid player of Zoo Tycoon when I was younger, and I can confidently, and whole heartedly say this game is significantly better. The art style is charming, with animal behaviors that are a treat to watch. The building and operating of your zoo is challenging while remaining manageable. My only possible gripe with the game would be that, if you are left handed, you will need to re-calibrate the keys involved with rotating and moving objects so that building isn't unweildy.
An unbelievable game, stunning graphics and thought out game play
This game is the reason I got a PC back when the game was a PC exclusive. The game is great and the management is fun.

There's a really steep learning curve to the game, and it takes a while to get a handle on the controls. When you do, though, the game is really enjoyable and fun to play. The level of customization is amazing--you can decide the height and type of wall used, you can sculpt terrain, you can paint different substances onto the ground (long grass, short grass, smooth sand, rough sand, snow, etc.), fill dips in the ground with water, and so much more. 
The animals are gorgeously animated and really fun to just watch run around and play with the enrichment items and each other. Each animal has a preferred strength of barrier (a must-have if you can place the animal in the habitat), size of habitat (land area, water area, and climbing area) and an amount of each biome on the ground. They also have a specific group size (for example, Tortoises are mostly solitary, while flamingos can be in massive groups and require others to be happy) and amount/type of enrichment items (a box to play with, a sprinkler, a blood pumpkin, etc.).
You can also place your paths for your visitors to walk on (customize the height off the ground and width of the path), place items for them to interact with (food/drink/merchandise stands, donation boxes, trash cans, benches, etc.), and information panels about your animals.
You need Keepers (and probably vets, caretakers, mechanics, and security) in your zoo to take care of your animals! You can place keeper huts for them to live in, special paths for them to walk on, and even change the color of their clothing.
There are several game modes, among them Sandbox, Franchise, Career, and Challenge modes. Usually, each item in the game costs a specific amount (in-game money, how much money your zoo has from guests paying through admission, donation boxes, food stands, etc.), so you are limited in the detail of your habitats, at least in the beginning. For Sandbox mode, everything is free, so you can experiment to get a feel for the controls, then make your dream zoo. I would recommend starting with Sandbox, but it's up to you. There is also a very helpful tutorial (Goodwin House) to help you with the basic functions of the game. 

Another point: there are about a dozen DLCs available to buy, which give you extra animals and building material. They are not mandatory to enjoy the game, and you can totally play without them! However, they include animals that are super cool, including the clouded leopard, coyote, kiwi, and more! 

So yes, I would very much recommend this game for people who want to create their dream zoo with their dream animals! Good luck!

ive played for 17 hours and this game is SOOO addicting. i've gotten this game like 4-5 days ago and ive already gotten a DLC and played for 17 hours if that doesn't convince you that this game is up there then... idk what will.

For anyone who loves management simulation games, Planet Zoo is a standout title that’s easy to get lost in. The animals are beautifully realized—from their designs and animations to the sheer variety of species—and it all feels impressively authentic. While the game’s main focus is on running your zoo, it also gives you incredible freedom to build it from the ground up. You can shape the terrain, design layouts, construct buildings, and decorate almost every detail. It does take creativity and patience to piece everything together, but that’s part of the fun. In the end, Planet Zoo is a polished, engaging simulation that will delight anyone who enjoys the genre.
Planet zoo has always been one of my fav's. From countless updates that are amazing to DLC that is worth the price. I will always recommend this game to anyone.
A beautiful and detailed building and simulation game with realistic animals and lots of creative freedom. The controls take some getting used to, but it becomes very fun and addictive.
A really fun and adictive game, just do yourself a favor and add this one to your collection
I find this game to be amazingly in depth with good graphics and accurate information. This game requires some thorough research/tutorials but is worth it!
Super amazing gameplay, lots of realistic building and animals. Visuals are amazing

Excellent game with hours of playability.  The interactions of the animals with their environment is very realistic and the gameplay overall is great.  Building and positioning could use some improvements, but it's far better than most world build types and the controls are pretty intuitive once you get a couple hours in.

Definitely one of the best games I've played. It's so detailed and full of amazing things to do ! It gets updated often, and the devs always work hard to respond to our feedbacks and to add new animals. I definitely recommend it... The mechanics are great, the graphics are amazing, and the possibilities are endless :D

There are just enough different aspects of a zoo to control without having too many things to overwhelm you. The art is great, the animals are so much fun to watch, and this is overall easily one of my favorite RTS/creative-type games.

Best park building game ever. lots of stuff to build, tons of animals. management is easy enough to not stress all the time. the "campaign" is a great way to learn how the game works. tons of dlc to choose from if you wanted more decoration or animals. franchise mod is a fun way to create different zoos with management. sandbox is the way if you wanted to build your dream zoo without money and management constrictions.

buy this game! or wait till planet zoo 2 drops in 2026

Very fun game! I have so much fun checking out my animals with the amazing graphics. The satisfaction of looking at your self-built exhibits is amazing. It is a bit pricey, but I say it is almost 100% worth it. Overall, I think this is one of the most addicting, fun games on the steam market. ( I think my ELA teacher would be proud :D )
its super cute and fun you can get lost in it for hours! i do reccomend it!

I love the freedom this game allows for creativity, even more than their other products do. I have played through all of the campaigns and make my own, as well, and it's so satisfying to see a zoo succeed!
I don't know how this game have worse pathing than a game that was released in the year 2004 , that aside building a habitat and seeing how the animals interact with the terrain is very relaxing.

This game has so much depth that it does not get boring to me: first I wanted all the animals, then very natural enclosures, than very scenic guest spaces, then very good education ….
It feels a bit like every animal comes in its own DLC, but the base game is good on it’s own – and I guess DLCs is what I have my job for  ^.-

Its good for people who like animals.

I only wrote this review for the nomination thingy.

But eitherway Planet zoo is good!

Edit:I Didn't nominate the game, I realised too soon
Very addictive game. played for 30+ hours and still craving for more.
amazing game for animal lovers, highly sandbox for those who dont want the grind of creating the perfect zoo while balancing money wages and customer satisfaction
It's a nice game, it's beautiful scenery, and beautiful animals you can buy it's the best game for those who like sandbox like games or like building zoo's
Very great and cute game, management was fun also.
I've sunk so many hours into this game in just a month, its addictive and i have found myself playing until 3 am multiple times on accident. Overall a very fun game.

Planet Zoo is a beautifully designed and well-thought-out simulation game with a huge variety of items that let you fully personalise your zoo. The building tools are creative and rewarding, and I love how detailed the animals and habitats are.

I have found the path system a bit difficult to navigate — especially when trying to create straight, square paths, as the game defaults to rounded edges and the grid toggle can be tricky to use. Making that system a little easier would really improve the building experience.

Aside from that, I’m really enjoying the game. Thank you to the developers, I’ve heard there may be a Planet Zoo 2 in the future, and I can’t wait to see what comes next!

Really great game. Amazing graphics and animal models especially in the newer DLC's. Really lets you embrase creaivity from the ground up. I enjoy sandbox the most and its crazy how much detail you can get in this game. i do think that the DLC's are a bit to expensive but they are on sale alot so its not that big of a deal. So exited for Planet Zoo 2.

Best management sim game EVER. Creative possibilities are almost endless with all the pieces and placement tools available. The animals look amazing as well. If you spent hundreds of hours playing Zoo Tycoon as a kid like me then this is the perfect game for you.

i love this game. i started a year ago and didnt even use career mode. I do suggest using career mode. I kind of taught myself but I really suggest this game. It has a very large selection of animals to take care of.

The game gives out banger creativity and has a great set of animals. I strongly recommend this game as it strengthens creativity and balances decision making. Download this game for the feeling of being a zoo owner!
pretty good fun game to spend some time on espically if you like sandbox games

i love this game its sad how this game is no longer getting a update which means no aquarium pack for sharks but atleast the part 2 will come with more improved and more awesome stuff BEST GAME EVER the only things i dont like is there are to much dlcs but idc bc this games still SUPER FRICKING AWESOME !

If you love animals, this is the game for you.

Pros:
- Gorgeous and realistic animals, with unique behaviours, sounds and animations. They're delightful.
- A massive number of animals and exhibit animals.
- In depth building mechanics with easy to grasp controls. If you've played Planet Coaster, it's very similar. It's so nice to be able to merge items together without the usual clipping being disallowed, and with the modular nature of the items meaning you can mix and match allowing you to build some amazing things.
- Several different modes, including challenge modes. I personally find sandbox modes boring so having goals to complete is very welcome. The main campaign alone took me literal years to complete.

Cons:
- The crowds are awful. I don't understand how in 6 years, the terrible AI mechanics for crowds has never been improved. Glitching into each other and getting stuck, trying to view animals through solid walls, they are genuinely an embarassment. You're not playing for the people, you're playing for the animals so it doesn't really matter but it is distracting.
- The DLC is extremely overpriced for the whopping 5 or occasionally 7 animals you get, with some scenery and a scenario. Buy those on sale, this is one of those games where the DLC will cost significantly more than the game itself.
- No achievements.

Aside from the two issues above, it's a great game and the animals are a joy, and the building is very satisfying. It's complex, interesting, and I've been playing it on and off for years. Definitely recommended.

I used to play tap zoo growing up. This game is far more sophisticated, allowing you to play at varying levels of difficulty which will establish your gameplay experience. i enjoy playing on easy, breeding groups of animals , and selling their offspring. I feel like i'm running an animal prison. i'm a terrible person, but whatever keeps my zoo at 5 stars and my pockets full.
Addictive and beautifully detailed, with an amazing community of creative people making extra props.
YES. Great game! The DLCs are priced out of this world, but the game is still super fun. If you have the patience to wait till deals lower the prices, this game and its DLCs are incredibly fun.

What can i say about this game that hasn't been said before? The modular building is where this game truly stands out, and what drew me to it in the first place. For those that don't enjoy that aspect, there's a surplus of absolutely amazing community builds to enjoy. The animal models are beautiful, though a close observer can tell the difference between the older models and the new ones. I do wish they'd spruce up some of the older models to match, but it is what it is. This game is highly customizable, so it can be as challenging or as chill as you want. The market does get a little outrageous in franchise mode, especially with some of the trending animals and morphs, but that's always the case with open markets. You can find some cool stuff on there, and besides the pretty chunk of change you pay for the complete game, there are no micro transactions or in game purchases within the game. You can easily (ish) get conservation points in game, and they transfer between franchise zoos (though not in challenge mode). 

I love this game! I've been playing on and off for years and I can see how frontier has taken the fans into consideration when releasing the dlcs (although still no birds or fully aquatic species, keeping an eye out for it in PZ2).  That said, I truly hope Planet Zoo 2 brings some much needed innovation. Although it's separate game, JWE3 felt like a clone of JWE2 with babies and building. Now I don't want to denigrate the work it took to incorporate those things into the game, and there's no doubt it was done well, but it seems like Frontier focused on these 2 new features to the exclusion of the rest of the game. I'm hoping PZ2 doesn't just focus on birds and aquatics (for example) and call it day.

Planet Zoo is a amazing animal game that lets you explore beyond your imagination. From a great variety of different animals, even without the DLC's, to multiple decoration pieces to build and create fantastic buildings in your zoo.
The decoration pieces have a ton of options. There are not to many without the DLC packs, but you can still build great buildings, fences and other unique creations.
The animal variety is far and beyond what you would expect. I love the options in my opinion, it is so many fun and great choices!
-
Extra:
Please fix the crashes! I crashed and lost all my progress, and I don't want others to experiment that.

LOVE this game. I have sunk many hours into it, nerding out with the zoology! Sometimes I'll chuck on a podcast and just build. When I am not feeling super creative, I'll work on improving my animals' genetics, releasing some to the wild, keeping some as breeding stock and contributing their good genes to the community! There are also rare leucistic, albino, and melanistic traits!

Had a lovely time designing a zoo featuring large, colorful statues made of the selection of primitive shapes, felt very powerful, also made a giant temple out of primitive shapes for worshipping myself
21 hours and I still suck at this stupid game I HATE IT SO MUCH THE CONTROLS ARE SO BAD BUT THANK THE LORDS MERCY THEY ARE CHANGEABLE OH MY GOD IT IS SO TERRIBLE! Good game!

This is an amazing game that offers an incredible amount of fun. The level of accuracy and detail is remarkable, making it, by far, the most enjoyable educational game I have ever experienced.

The attention to detail extends to the animals, their environments, the exhibits, and the high level of customization available. This game is an absolute dream come true and deserves to be enjoyed by many!

I would strongly recommend this magnificent game for installation on every school computer.

Thank you very much for the sale; I wouldn't have given it a second look otherwise, and I am so glad I did. 10/10.

Its a great game in general, the construction is very customisable and you can build some very amazing buildings or assets, my only gripe is the pathing system can be extremely fiddly sometimes and the terrain sculpting can be infuriating but you can work around a lot of these issues. all in all though i do love this game and will be first in line for planet zoo 2! (I just hope they pick a different way to implement pathing)
Addictive game. A lil glitch sometimes but its okay. I love all the info on the animals, feels like I really work at a zoo

i love this game! i am a animal lover and a free style type of game lover.
i can build whatever my imagination takes me to and totally zone out and spend hours on this game.
it's made very well and easy to figure out and get the hang off :) i always seem to come back to it
awesome cosy game. Building can be hard but i got used to it. God the paths system sucks

I've owned this game for a while now and have put hours into it. It is an absolutely beautiful game, the graphics are great, and it's incredibly detailed. I was looking for a sister-game to Zoo Tycoon, and while I love Planet Zoo and it's beautiful in it's own way, I will say it is not Zoo Tycoon. It is more tycoon focused along with building focused compared to the old ZT franchise which was much more animal focused. I give this game a 5/5 rating, it has a learning curve and is challenging.

Built a beautiful habitat. Animal hated it. Built a worse one. Animal loved it.
Also my monkeys keep escaping and my guests keep throwing trash at the bins.
10/10 chaos simulator.

Only recommend at a special DISCOUNT price. The game have too many options and too many buttons to click. I played for 3 hours and still on a tutorial and I still don't know how to place and edit things. When I'm done with one thing and have to wonder "Wtf do I do next" The game only tell you once and doesn't repeat the task, so if you didn't listen to what it asked you to do, good luck finding your way. This game has a massive entry barrier.
fun but very detailed. It can be intimidating but so pretty.

No other game I’ve played is quite like this one. Usually, a single zoo project lasts about a week for me before I hit a wall—I get stuck on how to continue developing it and feel a strong urge to start over. I’m not entirely sure why this happens; it’s probably a mix of feeling overwhelmed, wanting to rush through certain parts, having too many options, struggling to find scenery pieces that fit my vision, and—most importantly—the path system, which makes rebuilding nearly impossible once everything is connected. Still, I keep coming back to this game again and again.

I follow Planet Zoo ever since the alpha testing and it is genuinely one of my favorite games ever since, if not my true favorite of all times. The attention to the details, the attentiveness of making the animals' fur, the movements and behavior, the foliage(big fan), the building materials, the whole game just amazes me everytime i see something about the crew working on the game or the game itself. I love how you can play only to focus on the building part, but the same time you are not forced to decorate if you want to just sit and watch the animals or manage the zoo if that is your type of game. Still gorgeous, relevant and loveable after 6 years since release. Your only restrictions in the game are truly your imagination and time itself.
its really fun and highly customisable. only negative is the path laying tool.

negative.review: Amazing in theory, but it has the worst, most unintuitive, system for making buildings and paths. I normally love deep and complex game, and taking the time to learn them, but this makes me want to bash my head in. Be prepared for extreme frustration if you've not earned a minor degree in this game from youtube videos.

Game Looks Incredible but this is the most frustrating game I have ever played. Everyone of my Friends who have this Game played for like a few Hours and never returned this Game. This shit is extremely hard to learn. The tutorial is not great and most time people just go to Youtube for guides and all the Comments say this has taught them more than the game ever has. I got so angry over the building in my opinion its just stupid I know the way it is for people to build custom walls but for someone who doesn't want to do all that. Its super frustrating I will probably never touch this Game Again and if any friends ask about the game i will tell them to avoid it. It is such a Shame I love these types of Games i played all the Zoo Tycoon games and Jurassic World Evolved Games.

THIS GAME IS LOADED WITH DLC I DONT WANT TO PAY 100$ This is a decent game in general but you basicly have to pay for what animals and decor buildings ect i would have liked this game if i could add at least one of my ten favrot animals but i have to pay for the nine dollar north amarica pack this game is basicly 100$ i had to pay 50 dollars just to be dissapointed with having to pay for everything

If you like these kinds of games, I kind've recommend it. The main reasons I didn't is due to really bad/glitchy tutorials (with annoying dialogue that, if you need a reminder on what to do/how to do it, you have to listen to the same terrible jokes again. Would've been better if it just told you what you needed to know). Also, the game itself has a bunch of little glitches that bring the game down. Hint: If you ever find yourself wondering why something isn't working, don't forget to unpause in order for what you've done to come into effect.

All in all, an okay game in its genre but horrible tutorials and lots of little glitches would have me rate it at something like 45/100 with 50 being average or "buyable".

Really enjoyed playing this game - really fun, lots to learn and lots of content and things to think about - HOWEVER - the game is almost unplayable due to it freezing my whole PC between 10 mins-1 hr of playing.

Have tried to resolve the issue multiple ways (all the recommended by Frontier solutions + some from Reddit and Steam) - nothing has worked.

Completely ruined the game for me and probably will stop trying to play. Shame because it's such a good game otherwise. I've seen lots of other people have this issue (high end PC's, mods, no mods, big/small parks), so i presume it's a game bug - needs sorting ASAP.

Any recommendations would be helpful but i'm pretty sure it's a lost cause for now :(
Its incredibly frustrating to play. If you want to play a good zoo simulator game play Zoo tycoon 2.

I want to love this game and play it, but every time I feel a tingle of inspiration to give it a go I can't get past placing down paths.

My hours in this game are spent mostly opening the game, struggling to connect my buildings to a plaza because they are obstructed by the path itself, deleting the path, being unable to rebuild the path because it has created a separate grid, getting frustrated and disheartened because if I can't figure out something so simple as paths then what's the real scenery customisation going to be like? This has been a major block that has stopped me enjoying this game since I bought it near launch. I had the exact same problem with Planet Coaster and I should've learnt from that.

I know I am not alone in this too. There are many who have complained about it, and this being fixed is truly the difference between my buying Planet Zoo 2 or not.

The actual game screen does not match the promotional video. And I am disappointed with its true fitting degree since the game's animal graphics are really too blurry.  In terms of modeling clarity and operation, this game is not even in the same league as Jurassic Park: Evolution 3. Although it is sold for $25, in my opinion, false advertising is intolerable.

incredibly janky 
dlc spam ala paradox
piss poor performance 
ps if your game leans on players building stuff themselves dont make it incredibly janky
Clunky game with annoying mechanics with weird controls and menus. It's just not the standard controls and gameplay but in the annoying way
This game is horribly frustrating and quirky.  It's not intuitive at all.  I do not recommend it.
barely enough animals from the same region to get energized about making them a themed area. there should have been a focus into more exciting animals that can be got
I cant even figure this game out. The controls and everything are so difficult. I never even got to fully play it

i decided to buy this game because i love Jurassic World Evolution 3, but i got so disappointed again. yeah, again because i bought this game 4 years ago and refunded it because of how frustrating it was to play it. building itself is okay, but the rest? simply frustrating. menu is too complicated, the mechanics of doing basically anything is too complicated, putting animals in the encounter is too completed, like c'mon. also, i hate how many dlc this game has, it gives me The Sims vibe. it's time to refund it again

i wanted to like this so much. but there is...so little explanation behind how anything works. the controls are frustrating and tedious. im sure someone with more patience than i could build a beautiful park but nothing i do seems to work

Multiple hours of tutorials, only for the first scenario to start with no enrichment available for some species, pathing errors that I somehow can't troubleshoot through any of the thousand heatmaps, and guests who litter incessantly (that one at least feels true-to-life). Wish I hadn't bothered.
very confusing of what animal to spawn or even how to spawn a animal. pls do yourself a favor and play planet coaster.

Not Recommened cuz its so hard to the money in career more and like the visisters are so ungrateful and they have a problem with just about everything and literrly they hate how i even place a rock 
so no
The game is poorly optimized and doesn't run well even with my 4070.
Can't even do the tutorials without running into placement bugs that prevent progress.
doesnt work blacks out all my screens and never shows up used to work but doesnt now.
The game is hard to understand and the tips are not helpful
only great if u wanna spend 200$ on a DLC ANOTHER GAME that mirco dlc itself to death
Navigation alone was atrocious enough to make me give up trying to play this.
Camera angle absolutely sucks!

I normally love complex games, but not like this that before even starting the tutorial u need to surf youtube videos to understand how to play. 10 minutes to understand to adjust the camera... no way.
The camera controls are absolutely garbage. Requested a refund within 22 minutes of fighting the controls.
buggy game keeps crashing
this games performance is awful

Amazing in theory, but it has the worst, most unintuitive, system for making buildings and paths. I normally love deep and complex game, and taking the time to learn them, but this makes me want to bash my head in. Be prepared for extreme frustration if you've not earned a minor degree in this game from youtube videos.

The game is fun to play, but has loads of technical issues. Some of the zoos occasionally brick my PC. But strangely enough, I can still move the mouse in the game. I need to shut down my PC to be able to do anything else. Can't even open the Task Manager. If it can't even run on a high end PC, then I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone.

Interface navigation is a major nightmare. Slow in general, complicated. Building paths is a torture. But really the deal breaker is the controls. Horrible.

The bugs with staff pathing completely ruins the game. I’ve only had this game a week and I have had to restart and lose everything multiple times because the staff choose to walk in circles and no matter what I do to fix it or how much research I do on how to fix this issue, it persists. I’ve spent more hours doing trial and error attempts to fix issues than actual gameplay. Pain in my hole fr
very buggy, cant do most things very irritating and regret buying

If you like these kinds of games, I kind've recommend it. The main reasons I didn't is due to really bad/glitchy tutorials (with annoying dialogue that, if you need a reminder on what to do/how to do it, you have to listen to the same terrible jokes again. Would've been better if it just told you what you needed to know). Also, the game itself has a bunch of little glitches that bring the game down. Hint: If you ever find yourself wondering why something isn't working, don't forget to unpause in order for what you've done to come into effect.

All in all, an okay game in its genre but horrible tutorials and lots of little glitches would have me rate it at something like 45/100 with 50 being average or "buyable".

Really enjoyed playing this game - really fun, lots to learn and lots of content and things to think about - HOWEVER - the game is almost unplayable due to it freezing my whole PC between 10 mins-1 hr of playing.

Have tried to resolve the issue multiple ways (all the recommended by Frontier solutions + some from Reddit and Steam) - nothing has worked.

Completely ruined the game for me and probably will stop trying to play. Shame because it's such a good game otherwise. I've seen lots of other people have this issue (high end PC's, mods, no mods, big/small parks), so i presume it's a game bug - needs sorting ASAP.

Any recommendations would be helpful but i'm pretty sure it's a lost cause for now :(

I was really excited about the game while playing the tutorial missions and the scripted challenges. It's very much accurate to what running a real zoo would be like and that was really exciting and awesome to see! However, the controls are very clunky and the tutorials really don't help you learn how to do anything in sandbox mode which is what I was really planning on spending the most time on with this game. Even after searching online for hours to try and get things to work and look the way I wanted to for my zoo, nothing ever worked how I hoped, and it was more annoying and stressful than anything. 

So, if you're like me and were hoping for a replacement to zoo tycoon and a really detailed sandbox mode. This game is probably not for you, unless you're willing to put in a lot of time and effort for a result you may not be happy with in the end. If you're only planning on playing the scripted challenges with pre-made zoos, this is a great game for that.

I played 10 minutes of Zoo Tycoon 2 and had more fun that all my 200+ hours of Planet Zoo. I really wanted to like it and invested so much time trying to learn. My advice, skip it. They should have focused more resources into the basic mechanics. Sure, you can build a pretty zoo if you sink all your time into it. But does that make it fun? My answer is no.
Its incredibly frustrating to play. If you want to play a good zoo simulator game play Zoo tycoon 2.

I want to love this game and play it, but every time I feel a tingle of inspiration to give it a go I can't get past placing down paths.

My hours in this game are spent mostly opening the game, struggling to connect my buildings to a plaza because they are obstructed by the path itself, deleting the path, being unable to rebuild the path because it has created a separate grid, getting frustrated and disheartened because if I can't figure out something so simple as paths then what's the real scenery customisation going to be like? This has been a major block that has stopped me enjoying this game since I bought it near launch. I had the exact same problem with Planet Coaster and I should've learnt from that.

I know I am not alone in this too. There are many who have complained about it, and this being fixed is truly the difference between my buying Planet Zoo 2 or not.

The actual game screen does not match the promotional video. And I am disappointed with its true fitting degree since the game's animal graphics are really too blurry.  In terms of modeling clarity and operation, this game is not even in the same league as Jurassic Park: Evolution 3. Although it is sold for $25, in my opinion, false advertising is intolerable.
I cant seem to figure it out. The tutorial is okay but it didnt help much. I wouldnt recommend this game to any other blondes :)

Wow am I glad I waited until this game was on sale to get it lol The tutorial was fine, kind of wonky but not terrible. Kind of fun. Then I started my own zoo and all the bugs came in lol Just f*ing left and right there was a problem, the zoo keepers get stuck and won't feed your animals or give them water no matter if you delete the gate and put it back, move the bowls or restart. It's unplayable. EDIT*** I really wanted this game to work so I gave it a few more shots but I spent hours on hours just trying to test what bug was making it so my animals can't eat. Tried every. single. one. of the suggestions I could find to fix it and nothing worked. Submitted a bug report. Major dissapointment.

The game crashes every time. Even when the settings are on low. It happens every 10 minutes or so. No mods, no DLC's, computer has no problem with other higher demand games. 3 times the game had crashed and 1 other time it crashed my whole computer.

This game might be fun for certain people but to me it feels like I'm playing a developer mode level editor. It has all the tools for people who are into "Zoo painting" but the game-play itself isn't particularly engaging.

If you like these kinds of games, I kind've recommend it. The main reasons I didn't is due to really bad/glitchy tutorials (with annoying dialogue that, if you need a reminder on what to do/how to do it, you have to listen to the same terrible jokes again. Would've been better if it just told you what you needed to know). Also, the game itself has a bunch of little glitches that bring the game down. Hint: If you ever find yourself wondering why something isn't working, don't forget to unpause in order for what you've done to come into effect.

All in all, an okay game in its genre but horrible tutorials and lots of little glitches would have me rate it at something like 45/100 with 50 being average or "buyable".

Really enjoyed playing this game - really fun, lots to learn and lots of content and things to think about - HOWEVER - the game is almost unplayable due to it freezing my whole PC between 10 mins-1 hr of playing.

Have tried to resolve the issue multiple ways (all the recommended by Frontier solutions + some from Reddit and Steam) - nothing has worked.

Completely ruined the game for me and probably will stop trying to play. Shame because it's such a good game otherwise. I've seen lots of other people have this issue (high end PC's, mods, no mods, big/small parks), so i presume it's a game bug - needs sorting ASAP.

Any recommendations would be helpful but i'm pretty sure it's a lost cause for now :(

I was really excited about the game while playing the tutorial missions and the scripted challenges. It's very much accurate to what running a real zoo would be like and that was really exciting and awesome to see! However, the controls are very clunky and the tutorials really don't help you learn how to do anything in sandbox mode which is what I was really planning on spending the most time on with this game. Even after searching online for hours to try and get things to work and look the way I wanted to for my zoo, nothing ever worked how I hoped, and it was more annoying and stressful than anything. 

So, if you're like me and were hoping for a replacement to zoo tycoon and a really detailed sandbox mode. This game is probably not for you, unless you're willing to put in a lot of time and effort for a result you may not be happy with in the end. If you're only planning on playing the scripted challenges with pre-made zoos, this is a great game for that.

I played 10 minutes of Zoo Tycoon 2 and had more fun that all my 200+ hours of Planet Zoo. I really wanted to like it and invested so much time trying to learn. My advice, skip it. They should have focused more resources into the basic mechanics. Sure, you can build a pretty zoo if you sink all your time into it. But does that make it fun? My answer is no.
Its incredibly frustrating to play. If you want to play a good zoo simulator game play Zoo tycoon 2.
